intro: Notothixos incanus, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seeds, typical of the dandelion genus. Its leaves are narrow, silver-tinged, and often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Notothixos incanus is typically found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
